name: Solmar All Inclusive Resort & Beach Club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: For 5 nights in Jan 2006 I stayed at the Solmar Suites in an oceanfront room. If you do stay here, it is completely worth the money to stay in one of the ocean front rooms!! The sound of the waves crashing was unbelievable and set a nice mood to fall asleep to and wake up to each night and day. While you cant swim in the beach a few steps from your room, the sights and sounds are worth it, plus Medano beach where you can swim is a 20 minute walk away. Some reports found this hotel to be too far away from everything- I did not mind the walk- 20 minutes or so to downtown and the beach- and who doesnt need a bit of a walk on vacation? It'll help burn off all those Margaritas ;)
reviews.title: Awesome!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the staff to be incredibly friendly and helpful. Also as a female travelling alone, I felt safe in the area.
reviews.title: Holiday break @ December

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My only complaint would be that I had to move into a different room on my second day becuase it is a timeshare, but even that was no big deal. The staff moved everything for me. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone- I had a fantastic time here!
reviews.title: we loved it!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I visited Cabo during Christmas 2006 and stayed at Solmar for six nights. Overall, it was terrific and we would recommend staying there. It's probably not the place for everyone; it's probably one of the oldest hotels in the area physically, but that's actually an aspect we liked. It's in a fantastic location on a very quiet, secluded beach, situated near hotels Finnestra and the new something-Grand. At Solmar, there really is no 'glitter' and pretense. It is a more simple, quiet hotel that is reasonable in price, well-kempt and pretty, and there are tasty poolside drinks and food. The poolside service was excellent. We are a kind of couple who likes a little seclusion, sun, beer, and books by the poolside. If you're someone looking for a lot of action, glitzy rooms with granite countertops, and Internet connections 24 hours a day, this is not for you.
reviews.title: Hmmm Good and Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highlights: There are beautiful sunsets that are stunning from balcony or room's beach view; excellent food that is reasonably priced. Our bed was comfortable and the room great, although we didn't spend that much time in it. We had an ocean deluxe suite not right on the beach but from our balcony we could watch the many fishing boats and hear the ocean every night. We were happy with our room. The hotel's location is up a steep hill/sidewalk from the marina, but we never took a taxi into town or back to the hotel. We walked everywhere, easily. If you work on speaking Spanish and being friendly to the staff yourself, you will enjoy a friendly response, no matter how poorly you speak Spanish!
reviews.title: Great Location for a quiet romantic walk on the beach

likes.disliked: — Junior suites are on the sand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I just got home from the most amazing trip I have ever taken. He spent a lot of time researching where we would stay. We are so happy he chose Solmar Beach Club. We were taken care of in every way by the staff there and feel that we made friends that we hope to keep and make new memories with in the future. Thank you to many including Jose Luis, Patty, Tomas, Margarita and Olivia, Anabel, Miraslava, Oscar and Octavio. We miss you already!
reviews.title: Most Amazing Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Gina and Sean from Atlanta
reviews.title: All around just a great property!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time in Cabo and my single buddy and I picked the regular Solmar All Inclusive Resort for 10 days. Expedia had a little small text blurb about upgrading to a suite. When we arrived at the Solmar, our suite was waiting. This building is not brand new, but the age shows character and is immaculately maintained. Separate bedroom, 2 patios, kitchen, 2 bathrooms = amazing. I've never been to a hotel that had such great water pressure, unlimited hot water in giant tubs! Comfortable beds, masonry work on the walls like you will never see in new buildings.
reviews.title: Nice,affordable,great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: There are some time share people staying here, which means they are not all inclusive. Means all your food is plated, not buffet style slop. Food at all times of the day is presented very well, with excellent ingredients and taste. Sushi bar by the pool serves up delicious rolls from noon - 6pm.
reviews.title: Wonderful, friendly experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2 restaurants, one more pub style only open lunch dinner. Both serve drinks, and the pool bar does the rest, serving to those in the pool and at the restaurant or on the beach. Great drinks, the mango mix was fantastic. Beer on tap, or you can order cans of beer or pop as well which is rare. All the bottled water you need.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Solmar suites was an excellent place to stay. Beautiful beach and a short walk to divorce and lovers beach. The marina is a short walk and you can also take a water taxi to the other beaches. The only drawback was the partiers that were staying next to my husband and I. The students were up very late and distracted the sound of the ocean at night. You may want to avoid the Spring break time. The pools were never over packed and allowed for a very relaxing time. We would recommend Solmar Suites to anyone.
reviews.title: Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The view was the best part of this resort. Our room was a one bedroom, two bath which was great since we both became ill while there. The room was very clean and housekeepping was done in the mornings. The service was not good, even with tipping extensively. We used the "middle pool " it had a swim up bar but you had to get your own drinks. It was not busy but no one came around to the lounge chair area to order your drinks from. The service in the main bar was slow and mostly without a smile. The only meals we ate there were breakfast and bar snacks in the afternoon. The food was good, the prices were sky high. I would suggest eating in doors for breakfast as the flies are very abundant outdoors around the food. The drink prices were $4.50 for a beer and $8.50 for a cocktail (gin and tonic), during happy hour you can only order certain select drinks and only one kind of beer is available. The location is close to the Marina, although you walk up, down and around construction going on right now. It is a "doable" walk unless you have any physical problems. We were offered coupons for the 3 restaurants the hotel "owns", we used one at the El Galeon, but the meal you get with it is a fish fillet and pasta (no selection) if you want to order off the regular menu you can use the coupon for a $25.00 discount (which we did). The food was very good, the atmosphere and view were not. We had no problems with check out. Upon check in our room was not ready until 4:30pm.
reviews.title: View Beautiful
Get away from it all
reviews.text: Our first visit to Cabo San Lucas and we stayed at Solmar Suites, which we arranged through an RCI exchange. The hotel is small, compared to the mega resorts that have sprung up all along the beach. It's tucked away behind the cliffs and the view is absolutely breathtaking. We stayed in the hotel portion, which consists of small suites right on the beach. The one-bedroom suites are behind the hotel units. We could hear the waves crashing every night. Everyone talks about the short walk to the marina - which by the way is pretty much where you go in Cabo - but the walk is not easy for everyone, especially if it is brutally hot, as it was during our stay. It's up and down hills, up against a concrete wall and past construction. We usually walked one way and took a cab back. Well worth six dollars. If you aren't into bar-hopping or fishing, there isn't a lot to do in Cabo. A couple of hours along the Marina, with vendors and timeshare people in your face constantly, and we were ready for the quiet seclusion of Solmar. The pool is fantastic, the swim-up bar a treat and a mariachi band seranades every evening. Housekeeping was immaculate (we found one bug the day we declined housekeeping because of our schedule). The staff was friendly and responsive. We took the shuttle to Playa de Grande one day and used the pool. Nice, but we preferred the exclusivity of Solmar. Take in the Saturday night fiesta. It's well worth it! Also the dinner cruise, which was very, very well organized and fun. Food was great as well. We took a water taxi to the public beach but after being accosted by vendors every minute, we left after a couple of hours because it wasn't exactly relaxing. We said "no, gracias" but even that gets tiresome after 50 or 60 times. We wouldn't rush back to Cabo, but if we did we would stay again at the Solmar. A hidden treasure.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just got back from a week at the Solmar, my advise is spend a liitle more and stay somewhere else. The service is not very good, the staff are not very nice, and if you're hungry after 9:30pm you'd better be prepared to walk into town, because that place closes up, same too of the Playa Grande, the resort next door that guests of the Solmar have access to. You might want to use the pools there also, much nicer. There is a free shuttle bus that runs to and from the resorts. On another note, if you're looking for a great inexpensive place to eat,there is new restaurant in town, "La Fonda" a little bit off the beaten path, but well worth it.
reviews.title: There are better places to stay
Solmar was great!
reviews.text: From Alaska to Cabo San Lucas. Stayed at Solmar 7/8/06 for five days. It was great. The room was very clean and the bed was really comfortable considering it was a king. Even though you couldn't swim at the beach it was secluded and great to walk and get your feet wet. The pools were refreshing and with just a few people. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The resort was in a great location for walking to the Marina downtown. We did take the water taxi to Medano beach for $6 roundtrip. It wasn't crowded and the water was refreshing. There were a lot of vendors but we just said no thank you and they left us alone. Overall Solmar was a great place to stay. I felt like I was on a secluded island but yet only a ten minute walk to town. I would definitely go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you are looking for an all inclusive like one of the big chains, this probably isn't for you. The service staff was excellent! They prepare everything fresh and that takes time. We loved the pool, we sat there all day, laughed, ordered drinks, sushi, and food from the restaurant and had a good ole time.
reviews.title: Freshly prepared food, clean, and relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants and bar close early around 10ish.... so if you are looking for nightlife the center of everything is a quick ride or 10 minute walk. I've stayed in Cabo before and the last time I stayed at Dreams which was about a 20-30 minute van ride away from the action. So basically the location cannot be beat. You are in the heart of Cabo yet it feels like you are so far away from everything. It's a great little cove they are situated on.
reviews.title: One of Our Most Memorable Vacations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: Now the annoying part.... the front desk and timeshare lady, noise and tips :-(
reviews.title: First day of trip review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I booked a One Bedroom suite and regret it. Everyone else I was with booked a standard room and they all got upgraded anyways. I normally would be very upset but considering I was traveling with a group of friends, I let it go and was happy for them (just felt like a sucker.....with $800.00 less in their pockets). So don't waste your money on upgrades.
reviews.title: Quiet, relaxing, 50+

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a long plane ride from NYC, I expected to be greeted with perhaps a cocktail and a smile but it was a haggling disaster at the front desk. They charged 60 dollars for WiFi and offered us a "free" drink at their sister resort which ended up costing us $300.00. The "free" drink is a house margarita or tap beer. No thank-you......
reviews.title: peacefull setting within minutes of action

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great resort if you want to rest and regenerate from hectic lives we lead. We've been here many times before and love it everytime. The staff is ALWAYS wonderful. The food and drink are really good, most importantly the cervesa is COLD. We did not do the all inclusive as we love to walk into town (10 min) to experience a variety as well as eat in after we've been to the grocery store. This time of year we are able to watch whales off our decks which is so cool while having our morning coffee in the sun. These rooms are very clean and well appointed; they are more of the "old mexico" rather than the extravigant but absolutely comfortable.
reviews.title: Quiet, restful and laid back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I visited from San Diego for 4 nights Mon Jan 14 2013 to fri 18.
reviews.title: Please promote Jose to Manager! every thing else was horrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Ok lets start with the first night that we were there when we were both spent and in bed sleeping at around 8pm a housekeeping lady knocked on the door, let herself in after we told that we were sleeping. I had to escort her out and went back to bed.(weird)
reviews.title: If I Have To Work.......:)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends

We told the Reps that fact that we were not able to commit to 80 000 usd time share. at a place we have never even been to before. the guy got pissed and cursed us out in spanish. Thanks alot guy!
reviews.title: Nice Resort, awesome city!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the food was horrible one bad meal after another! we eventually just stopped eating there even though it was free. I rate the food 0 out of ten. A child can cook better than this.
reviews.title: Very surprising

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2005
reviews.text: The first thing. Location. Less than a mile is Downtown, but up a Little sidestreet by the harbor is the hotel, which is very close to town, yet by the quietness you feel like you are 100 miles away. The beach is close, but you are not allowed to swim there, so you have to walk over some big rocks (fun for the adventurer, bad for the Lazy). There is Lover's beach, and right around the corner is another small beach, where all the companies from Cabo take their guests Snorkeling. Great fun. The room was very "beachy" with white walls and older appliances, the usual though for Mexico, which was actually nice because it was a very Mexican style hotel. The rooms have balconies, some you can walk on them to the beach. The pool is SOOOOOO cool. There is a bar that you can swim up to and sit on underwater chairs and eat or drink. Not much else to say besides i will probably be back!
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: We got to Solmar suites through a RCI interchange. We arrived late night and got a room in building G. This building happens to be over the laundry, so we got noise 24 hours. The noise was really loud and we didn't got an hour sleep during all night. In the morning we went to complain and they offered us to move to the adjacent building, that happens to be next to the central air conditioning machines, so is as noisy as building G. We complained and they offered to move us to a room in the basement and without windows....
reviews.title: terrible stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: The service was extremely not nice and the accomodations were terrible. really, the worst experience we had in our many trips. The hotel is nice and the beach-side rooms look really nice, but the high-rise buildings are terrible and the service stinks. The prices are quite high and would not recommend this hotel to other travelers.
reviews.title: Lovely Peaceful Place with Great Views/Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 6 nights at Solmar over Memorial weekend in late May/early June 06. We came to "get away from it all" - we wanted peace and quiet, beauty, and a location where we could easily get to town for dining, shopping, sight-seeing, etc.
reviews.title: Solmar Suites - Beware You Will Be Disapponited -
Loved it! Excellent for what WE were looking for...
reviews.text: We booked directly through Solmar's website, taking advantage of a discount they were offering. We were extremely happy with our choice and our stay - they gave us an excellently located room, provided very good service, and never once gave us grief for being there "on the cheap." We were "introduced" to the lady who turned out to be the local timeshare salesperson as part of check-in, but once we firmly told her we were not interested, we were not bothered for the remainder of our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We went to the Solmar for a much needed vacation and ended up feeling like we could not leave the property. Overall the rooms were ok - we had a garden view suite with a small kitchen and patio on the ground floor. When we made the reservation - over the phone - we asked for a bed with 2 double beds. When we went to the room there was only 1 bed and we were told that the garden suites had only 1 king sized bed and if we wanted 2 beds we would have to upgrade to an ocean view suite which was much smaller and more expensive.
reviews.title: Solmar Staff Sucks!
Not worth it at all...
reviews.text: At the airport we accepted an invitation to go to the Westin hotel to see their time share property. Upon checking in we were sent to the activities desk where this woman named Tammy proceeded to invite us to the Playa Grande time share presentation - Playa Grande is their sister property. We politely refused and did not mention we had accepted an invitation to go to the Westin. When we were leaving the next morning she was very rude to us, she followed us through the lobby demanding to know where we were going and calling us liars because we did not mention we were going to another time share presentation. We ignored her and she proceeded to yell after us that we were not to take a shuttle from that hotel to get back to the airport and that we should let the Westin arrange a shuttle for us. (We had not told her where we were going).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We complained to the manager who said this was the first time they had heard such complaints and went on to say she was just an independent operator and was not really a Solmar employee - which is a lie. Overall I would not stay at Solmar Suites again.
reviews.title: Some concerns

likes.liked: — the food at the pool bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reviews on this site often make or break my decision to book a specific hotel. In reading about the Solmar Suites, the place sounded pretty good. But even a brief peek below the surface reveals a lot to be concerned about.
reviews.title: An OK experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had one of their oceanview suites. Situated right on a deserted beach (because the ocean is too rough to enter) with private balconies or terraces. It sounded ideal.
reviews.title: Nice resort at a perfect location

likes.liked: — very convenient location, clean room, open view of the beach and ocean, quiet, good food in restaurant, friendly staff
likes.disliked: — swimming pools are kind of small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Did a three night all inclusive stay and it was amazing! All inclusive included free meals at the restaurant, snack bar, bottled water, sushi bar, and pool bar! The food and drinks were great. All the employees were friendly. Got a free upgraded room! They had a Mexican buffet one night with dancers! Location was perfect. A short walk into town. You cant swim in the ocean right in front of the resort but you can also climb a rocky mountain right next to the resort and walk to divorce and lovers beach which you can swim in. Would definitely stay here again!!!!!!!
reviews.title: cabos best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'll make this short and easy, if you are looking for a quiet place with good service and decent food then this is the place for you. Staff are very knowledgeable of the area and how to get around and where to go. Plus the resort opens on to the beach for easy access. Would I recommend to a friend? Yes :)
reviews.title: Solmar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012
reviews.text: The staff makes this resort function. David, Gerardo, Juan, Andre's are excellent concierge. Jose in the restaurant is the best. Teresa and Linda are excellent at the front desk. The facilities are not the most up to date, but the staff make this resort worth going too.
reviews.title: The staff makes this place worth visiting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Solmar exceeded all of my expectations! I read several reviews before taking my trip and didn't know quite what to expect given the comments about the high pressure time share people. My experience could not be further from the negative comments about Solmar. After a long and exhausting experience at the car rental place (you DO NOT need a car to stay at Solmar btw), I was just ready to get checked in and start my vacation already.
reviews.title: A Very Merry Christmas!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: My experience at check-in was very smooth. We were offered an upgrade to and ended up in a room with three decks; all with breathtaking ocean views. In fact, we saw several whales right from our deck! Our room was very clean! My compliments to Zusanna!!!
reviews.title: Sol mar Pacific ocean view is gorgeous

aka: Solmar All Inclusive Resort And Beach Club
description: Looking for a warm, welcoming hotel in Cabo San Lucas with a spectacular view, central location and attentive service? Look no further than The Solmar All Inclusive Resort and Beach Club. This cozy Mexican property is nestled on the exclusive Playa Solmar at the southernmost tip of the Baja peninsula where the Pacific Ocean meets the Sea of Cortez. Featuring one of the most enchanting and romantic locations in Baja California, The Solmar is just steps from the shopping, dining, and nightlife of downtown Cabo San Lucas and the bustling Cabo Marina.On top of all the sun and fun, The Solmar Resort is All Inclusive. You can enjoy a la carte meals, drinks and snacks at all the resort restaurants, plus theme nights, social activities and much more. There are no buffet lines. Just fresh food, delicious dining and plenty of recreation when ever you’re ready. The All Inclusive Plan includes a welcome cocktail in the Trebol Restaurant Bar, a la carte breakfast, lunch and dinner, theme night dinners, a sushi bar, and a wide range of beverages and snacks. But that’s not all. There are social activities, buy one get one free massages, laundry service, the use of fitness facilities, tennis courts and mini-golf at sister resort Playa Grande and even a 10% discount at the nearby Galeon, Romeo & Juliet and Hacienda Coyote restaurants. The Solmar Resort décor mirrors the unique desert-by-the-sea terrain characteristic of Los Cabos. Stone walls with arched doorways, tile floors and wood accents create a warm, authentic ambiance. Guests can choose from junior suites, studios and deluxe one-bedrooms. Every room features a patio or balcony overlooking Playa Solmar and the Pacific Ocean. The Sea of Cortez serves as a stunning backdrop at El Trebol sports bar and restaurant. Tejaban, the poolside bar, invites visitors to dine in shorts and swimsuits. And theme dinners are available at Tejaban restaurant. The Solmar is a dream come true for every member of the family. The three-section pool features a large children's area and swim-up cantina, while the adults-only pool provides wave-resistance lap swimming. The list of things to see and do in Los Cabos is almost endless. The concierge can arrange sport fishing, golf, sunset cruises, snorkeling, whale-watching and much, much more. And remember, when the sun goes down in Cabo, the nightlife heats up.
